title: California Grand Casino
text:
The California Grand Casino is a <a href="cardroom">cardroom</a> located in <a href="Pacheco%2C%20California">Pacheco, California</a>. The original hotel and card room was a <a href="Pony%20Express">Pony Express</a> stop in 1860. According to "<a href="Card%20Player">Card Player</a>" magazine, the California Grand Casino is the oldest continuously operating poker room in the world, with poker games since 1854.
A new <a href="casino">casino</a> facility opened across the street in July 2009 with 19 gaming tables, a bar and a restaurant called The Grand Cafe. For six years in a row, the California Grand Casino was voted Best Casino in the San Francisco East Bay by the <a href="Bay%20Area%20News%20Group">Bay Area News Group</a>, which includes the <a href="Contra%20Costa%20Times">Contra Costa Times</a>, <a href="San%20Jose%20Mercury%20News">San Jose Mercury News</a> and <a href="Oakland%20Tribune">Oakland Tribune</a>. 
History.
The casino started in 1854 when the Woodford Hotel and Saloon opened its doors on what is now Pacheco Boulevard and offered alcohol, women and gambling. The hotel became a <a href="stagecoach">stagecoach</a> and Wells Fargo <a href="Pony%20Express">Pony Express</a> Stop in 1860. The original building bears a historical marker from the Pony Express Trail Association.
In 1979, Lamar "Wil" Wilkinson, a poker player who has made 7 final tables at the <a href="World%20Series%20of%20Poker">World Series of Poker</a> in <a href="Las%20Vegas">Las Vegas</a>, purchased the casino. He changed the name to the California Grand Casino, and in 2009 moved the casino into a new building.
Games.
The California Grand Casino offers <a href="Texas%20hold%20%27em">Texas hold 'em</a> poker games, Omaha poker (currently Omaha is not offered post-pandemic), and a weekly Hold Em tournament (currently there is no tournament post-pandemic). The poker games all feature three blinds, meaning that the player on the button also posts a blind bet. This leads to more players seeing the flop and more action in the games. The Casino has a number of poker jackpots and prizes with more than $23 million in jackpots paid to players.
The California Grand Casino also has Hot Action Blackjack, <a href="Baccarat%20%28card%20game%29">Baccarat</a>, <a href="Three%20Card%20Poker">Three Card Poker</a>, and Pai Gow Poker games. In <a href="California">California</a>, the casino does not bank the games, so these games are played with a rotating dealer position so every player has the chance to play the <a href="Croupier">dealer</a> hand and wager against the other players, but the casino dealer still does the actual dealing and settling of all wagers.
